summary: The Chronic Disease Flexible Coverage Act (H.R. 919) aims to codify IRS guidance regarding the treatment of certain services and items for chronic conditions. It specifies that these services and items can be considered preventive care under high-deductible health plans linked to health savings accounts. The bill seeks to give the IRS guidance the same legal standing as if it were explicitly included in the Act. It aims to improve healthcare accessibility for those with chronic conditions.
